IRS990.Desc: THE FOUNDATION OVERSEES MORE THAN 140 ACTIVE SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISTRIBUTED 623 SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO 582 INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS TO ASSIST SCHOLARS WHO FACE FINANCIAL BARRIERS TO ACCESS, PERSISTANCE, AND SUCCESS IN COLLEGE. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDDS ARE MADE BASED ON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY DONORS, WHICH MAY INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, DEMONSTRATED LEADERSHIP STRENGTHES, SPECIFIC PROGRAMS OF STUDY, AND FINANCIAL NEED.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: GRANTS EXTENDED TO 21 PROJECTS INITIATED BY FACULTY AND STAFF TO SEED INNOVATION AND FUEL STUDENT AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES. GRANT FUNDS ALSO SUPPORTED STUDENT TRAVEL FOR COMPETITIONS AND STUDY ABROAD OPPORTUNITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: $22,537 IN EMERGENCY FUNDS PROVIDED TO 36 STUDENTS WHO FACED CIRCUMSTANCES THAT MIGHT PREVENT THEM FROM CONTINUING THEIR EDUCATION AND 2 EMPLOYEES WHO EXPERIENCED UNEXPECTED HARDSHIP. ADDITIONAL FUNDS SUPPORTED AWARDS FOR STUDENT COMPETITIONS AND EMPLOYEE EXCELLENCE RELATED TO EXCEPTIONAL STUDENT SERVICE.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: LINE 12G(VI) AMOUNTS OF OTHER SUPPORT INCLUDE DONATIONS OF EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES RECEIVED BY THE FOUNDATION THAT BENEFITS SPECIFIC DEPARTMENTS OR ACTIVITIES OF THE COLLEGE
OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT 535 IS A GOVERNMENT ENTITY AND DOES NOT HAVE AN IRS DETERMINATION

THE PRESIDENT AND CHIEF ADVANCEMENT OFFICER OF THE COLLEGE ARE ON THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE OF THE FOUNDATION. ADDITIONALLY, THE CHIEF ADVANCEMENT OFFICER AND CONTROLLER OF THE COLLEGE ARE ON THE FINANCE AND INVESTMENT COMMITTEE OF THE FOUNDATION.

OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT 535, A GOVERNMENT ENTITY, RECEIVED SUPPORT FROM THE EDUCATION FOUNDATION FOR (1)OAKTON STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS TOTALING $963,440 TO BOLSTER RETENTION AND DEGREE/CERTIFICATION ATTAINMENT; (2) GRANTS TO FACULTY AND STAFF TOTALING $335,498 FOR CAMPUS IMPROVEMENTS, NEW TECHNOLOGY, WORKPLACE READINESS, STUDENT LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT AND CULTURAL PROGRAMS AND EVENTS AND (3) AWARDS, PRIZES AND OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TOTALING $29,278 FOR OAKTON STUDENTS, FACULTY AND STAFF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PER NOTE 2G OF AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: COLLECTIONS OF ART ACQUIRED THROUGH PURCHASES AND CONTRIBUTIONS SINCE THE FOUNDATION'S INCEPTION ARE NOT RECOGNIZED AS ASSETS ON THE STATEMENT OF FINANCIAL POSITION. ART OBJECTS ARE HELD FOR EDUCATIONAL AND CURATORIAL PURPOSES AND ARE SUBJECT TO A POLICY THAT REQUIRES PROCEEDS FROM THEIR SALES TO BE USED TO ACQUIRE OTHER ITEMS FOR COLLECTIONS. PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS ARE RECORDED AS DECREASES IN NET ASSETS WITHOUT DONOR RESTRICTIONS IN THE YEAR IN WHICH THE ITEMS ARE ACQUIRED OR AS NET ASSET WITH DONOR RESTRICTIONS IF THE ASSETS USED TO PURCHASE THE ITEMS ARE RESTRICTED BY DONORS. CONTRIBUTED COLLECTION ITEMS ARE NOT REFLECTED ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. PROCEEDS FROM DEACCESSIONS OR INSURANCE RECOVERIES ARE REFLECTED AS INCREASES IN THE APPROPRIATE NET ASSET CLASSES.
PER NOTE 2G OF THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: ART OBJECTS ARE HELD FOR EDUCATIONAL AND CURATORIAL PURPOSES.

THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENTS ARE USED TO MAKE LEARNING ACCESSIBLE TO STUDENTS IN NEED AND TO ENHANCE THE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES OF OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT 535. SPECIFICALLY, THE ENDOWMENTS PROVIDE A) SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ENABLING STUDENTS TO ACCESS HIGHER EDUCATION AND B) FUNDING FOR CRITICAL INITIATIVES, INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS AND/OR UNIQUE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES THAT FALL OUTSIDE THE COLLEGE'S ANNUAL OPERATING BUDGET.

THE FOUNDATION IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE FOUNDATION IS NOT CLASSIFIED AS A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE FOUNDATION EVALUATES ITS UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, AND THERE HAVE BEEN NO RECORDED UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS RECORDED IN 2023, 2022 OR 2021. THEREFORE, NO PROVISION OR LIABILITY FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION FILES VARIOUS FEDERAL OR STATE NON-PROFIT TAX RETURNS. THE FOUNDATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL OR STATE EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR TAX YEARS PRIOR TO 2020.

GRANT FUNDS RECEIVE A UNIQUE EXPENSE CODE IDENTIFIER IN THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNT SYSTEM, WHICH IS MONITORED BY THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNTING OFFICE. DIRECT DISBURSEMENTS ARE MANAGED BY THE FOUNDATION'S SENIOR MANAGER OF FINANCE AND OPERATIONS. BOTH PARTIES ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR OBTAINING ADEQUATE SUPPORT DOCUMENTATION FOR EACH CLAIM.
THE FOUNDATION AWARDS GRANTS TO THE COLLEGE TO FOSTER EDUCATIONAL INNOVATION AND OTHER STRATEGIC INITIATIVES THAT SUPPORT STUDENT LEARNING.

EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE TO SUPPORT BOTH STUDENTS AND EMPLOYEES WHEN HARDSHIPS ARISE. STUDENT EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED UPON THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE COLLEGE'S VICE PRESIDENT FOR STUDENT AFFAIRS. THESE FUNDS COVER THE COST OF SHORT-TERM EMERGENCY NEEDS SO THAT STUDENTS CAN REMAIN IN SCHOOL AND COMPLETE THEIR EDUCATION. WHENEVER POSSIBELE, PAYMENTS ARE MADE TO THIRD PARTIES ON BEHALF OF THESE STUDENTS. EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED UPON THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE COLLEGE'S CHIEF HUMAN RESOURCE OFFICER. THESE FUNDS PROVIDE MONETARY ASSISTANCE TO EMPLOYEES OF THE COLLEGE WHO ARE AFFECTED BY MAJOR DISASTER (FLOOD, FIRE, ETC.), DEATH, OR MAJOR ILLNESS OR INJURY.

COMPENSATION PROCESS IS DETERMIED BY OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE, AND IS BASED ON A SALARY SCHEDULE USING THE HAY GROUP METHOD AND COMPENSATION SURVEY. COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY THE OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES AS AN ACROSS THE BOARD INCREASE FOR ALL ADMINISTRATORS. OAKTON DOES NOT HAVE MERIT BASED RAISES.

THE PRESIDENT OF OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT 535 IS AN EX-OFFICIO DIRECTOR OF THE FOUNDATION. THE FOUNDATION AND THE COLLEGE DO NOT PROVIDE COMPENSATION FOR THE COLLEGE PRESIDENT IN THE CAPACITY AS A MEMBER OF THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD.
THERE IS NO REVENUE REPORTED AND THE VALUE OF THE ART IS NOT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD ADDED OR UPDATED POLICIES RELATED TO SIGNATURE AUTHORITY AND SCHOLARSHIPS. ON 9/20/22, THE BOARD AGREED TO TRANSFER ALL ASSETS RELATED TO THE ART COLLECTION TO OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE. ON 12/1/22, THE BOARD AGREED TO ENTER INTO A MOU WITH THE ILLINOIS COMMUNITY COLLEGE STATE FOUDNATION TO ACCEPT GIFS OF QUALIFIED CHARITABLE DISTRIBUTIONS FROM RETIREMENT FUNDS ON THE FOUNDATION'S BEHALF. ON 3/1/23, THE BOARD UPDATED ITS MOU WITH OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE AS PART OF ITS TWO-YEAR REVIEW PRACTICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT COPY OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION BOARD. FORM 990 IS FILED AFTER IT IS APPROVED BY THE FOUNDATION BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY STATES THAT IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, A BOARD MEMBER MUST DISCLOSE THE EXISTENCE OF THE FINANCIAL INTEREST AND BE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISCLOSE ALL MATERIAL FACTS TO THE DIRECTORS AND MEMBERS OF COMMITTEES WITH GOVERNING BOARD DELEGATED POWERS CONSIDERING THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL COMPENSATION IS PAID BY A RELATED PARTY OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT 535. COMPENSATION PROCESS IS DETERMINED BY OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE, AND IS BASED ON A SALARY SCHEDULE USING THE HAY GROUP METHOD AND COMPENSATION SURVEY. COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY THE OAKTON COMMUNITY COLLEGE'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES AS AN ACROSS THE BOARD INCREASE FOR ALL ADMINISTRATORS. OAKTON DOES NOT HAVE MERIT BASED RAISES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THROUGH OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.OAKTON.EDU/GIVING AND UPON REQUEST FOLLOWING OUR PUBLIC INFORMATION POLICY.
